lines.text: Hey! It's still our party.
[Father Dan has just tried to kiss Jeffrey]
Wait! You're really a priest?
Of course.
But... I mean, aren't you supposed to be straight and celibate?
Maybe you didn't hear me. I'm a CATHOLIC priest. Historically, that falls somewhere between chorus boy and florist.
[opening lines]

[voice over]
I love sex. It's just one of the truly great ideas. I mean, just the fact that our bodies have this built-in capacity for joy, oh it makes me love God. Yes!
But Darius is a dancer. He's in "Cats."
Exactly. I said you needed a boyfriend, not a person.
You know, Darius once said you were the saddest person he knew.
Why did he say that?
Because he was sick. He had a fatal disease. And he was a million times happier than you.
I will find a substitute for sex. Sex Lite. Sex Helper. I Can't Believe It's Not Sex!
I can walk!
You could always walk.
Shut up.
[Regarding his brush with Mother Theresa]
She looked good.
Please, she's had work done.
Who's Martha Stewart?
She writes picture books about gracious living. Martha says that nothing else matters if you can do a nice dried floral arrangement. I worship her.
And, um, who's Ann Miller?
Leave this house.

[putting on a red shawl]
Can I do this, or will I look like some sort of gay superhero?
Sweetheart, are you a top or a bottom?
Hi, my name is Dave and I am sexually compulsive.
Dad, I am not going to have phone sex with you and mom!
Two cappuccinos. Thank you, darling. Big kiss. The earring - fun... last year.
BI-SEXUAL!
Oh, me too...
Who is your biggest sexual fantasy?

[wipes the side of his mouth seductively]
Den-ZEL Washington.
The guy at the gym.
Yoko Ono.
[everyone looks at Sterling with a suprised look]
To see the apartment!

Yes, I am in CATS. Now and forever. The way I see it, I was too young for Chorus Line, and too "happy" for Les Mis. I never did get that show. It's about a guy, who steals a loaf of bread, and then suffers for the rest of his life. For toast! Get over it.
I love the Nutcracker. You know when I was a kid I was always afraid of the dancing mice. Now I'm a cat.
His therapist is ecstatic.
It all goes back to mother, doesn't it? Did you love your mother?
Yes.
Don't lie to me. I'll call her.
So what happens after today's parade?
Angelique is going to remove her penis!
It's coming *right* off!
How dare you give up sex when there are children in Europe who can't get a date?
There is only one real blasphemy - the refusal of joy! Of a corsage and a kiss!
[last lines]

[flicking Steve a red balloon]
I dare you.
